title-part.text: FLUID HEATERS, e.g. WATER OR AIR HEATERS, HAVING HEAT GENERATING MEANS, IN GENERAL

reference.text: heat-transfer, heat-exchange or heat-storage materials C09K5/00; tube furnaces for thermal non-catalytic cracking C10G9/20; devices, e.g. valves, for venting and aerating enclosures F16K24/00; steam traps or like apparatus F16T; steam generation F22; combustion apparatus F23; domestic stoves or ranges F24B, F24C; domestic- or space-heating systems F24D; furnaces, kilns, ovens, retorts F27; heat-exchangers F28; electric heating elements or arrangements H05B

note.note-paragraph: The distinguishing feature of the air heaters covered by this subclass is that the heat is predominantly released to the air by convection, mostly by forced circulation of the air. The domestic stoves or ranges covered by subclasses F24B, F24C may also be fired or electric air heaters but they release their heat to a considerable extent by radiation and only to some extent by natural convection.

In this subclass the following terms are used with the meanings indicated: "Water" includes other liquids; "air" includes other gases or gas mixtures; "water" and "air" always mean, respectively, the liquid and gas to be heated; "Furnace tubes" means tubes inside the heater wherein combustion is performed; "Fire tubes" means tubes inside the heater through which flue-gases flow from a combustion chamber located outside the tubes; "Heater" means apparatus including both heat generating means and means for transferring the generated heat to water or air.
All storage heaters are classified in group F24H7/00.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Water heaters having heat generating means, e.g. boiler, flow- heater, water-storage heater

reference.text: F24H7/00, F24H8/00 take precedence; details F24H9/00; steam boilers F22B; domestic stoves or ranges with additional provisions for heating water F24B9/00, F24C13/00

CPC-specific-text.text: of the reduced pressure or vacuum steam type
Gas- or oil-fired immersion heaters for open containers or ponds

title-part.text: Packaged or self-contained boilers, i.e. water heaters with control devices and pump in a single unit
Continuous-flow heaters, i.e. in which heat is generated only while the water is flowing, e.g. with direct contact of the water with the heating medium

CPC-specific-text.text: with bare resistances in direct contact with the fluid
formed by the tube through which the fluid flows

title-part.text: in which the water is kept separate from the heating medium
by tubes, e.g. bent in serpentine form

reference.text: combined with water-heating stoves for central heating F24H1/22; F24H1/50 takes precedence
containers or tanks in general B65D, e.g. metal containers B65D7/00
containers with thermal insulation in general B65D81/38
linings for containers in general B65D25/14, B65D90/04

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for compensating water expansion

title-part.text: with immersed heating elements, e.g. electric elements or furnace tubes

CPC-specific-text.text: with tubes filled with heat transfer fluid

title-part.text: Water heaters other than continuous-flow or water storage heaters, e.g. water-heaters for central heating
with water mantle surrounding the combustion chamber or chambers
the water mantle forming an integral body
including one or more furnace or fire tubes

CPC-specific-text.text: with flue gas passages built-up by coaxial water mantles
with the fire tubes arranged alongside the combustion chamber
with the fire tubes arranged in line with the combustion chamber

title-part.text: the water mantle being built up from sections
with vertical sections arranged side by side
with water chamber arranged adjacent to the combustion chamber or chambers, e.g. above or at side
the water chamber including one or more fire tubes
with water contained in separate elements, e.g. radiator-type element

CPC-specific-text.text: the water tubes being arranged in one or more circles around the burner
the tubes forming a membrane wall

title-part.text: with combinations of two or more of the types covered by groups F24H1/24 - F24H1/40,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. boilers having a combination of features covered by F24H1/24 - F24H1/40

title-part.text: Water heaters having plural combustion chambers
Water heaters for central heating incorporating heaters for domestic water
incorporating heat exchangers for domestic water

CPC-specific-text.text: Heat exchangers for sanitary water directly heated by the burner
Pipes in pipe heat exchangers for sanitary water

title-part.text: Air heaters having heat generating means

reference.text: F24H7/00, F24H8/00 take precedence; details F24H9/00; domestic stoves or ranges with additional provisions for convection heating of air F24B, F24C

CPC-specific-text.text: with a closed circuit for a heat transfer liquid

title-part.text: the air being in direct contact with the heating medium, e.g. electric heating element

CPC-specific-text.text: using electric energy supply, e.g. the heating medium being a resistive element; Heating by direct contact, i.e. with resistive elements, electrodes and fins being bonded together without additional element in-between
Structures comprising heat spreading elements in the form of fins
Interfaces between the electrodes of a resistive heating element and the power supply means
Forms of the electrode terminals, e.g. tongues or clips
Two-piece frames, e.g. two-shell frames, also including frames as a central body with two covers
Multiple-piece frames assembled on their four or more edges
Means for putting the electric heaters in the frame under strain, e.g. with springs

title-part.text: the air being kept separate from the heating medium, e.g. using forced circulation of air over radiators

CPC-specific-text.text: using electric energy supply; the heating medium being the resistive element
The tubes being an electrical isolator containing the heater
The tubes being an electrode for the heater
The tubes containing an electrically heated intermediate fluid, e.g. water

title-part.text: Storage heaters, i.e. heaters in which energy is stored as heat in masses for subsequent release

reference.text: domestic stoves or ranges with additional heat storage masses F24B1/24, F24C15/34

title-part.text: the released heat being conveyed to a transfer fluid, e.g. air, water

the transfer fluid being a liquid
the transfer fluid being a liquid

CPC-specific-text.text: the transfer medium being a liquid
the transfer fluid being a liquid
the transfer fluid being a liquid

title-part.text: Fluid heaters having heat-generating means specially adapted for extracting latent heat from flue gases by means of condensation

CPC-specific-text.text: having means for moistening the combustion air with condensate from the combustion gases
Means for removing condensate from the heater
Sleeves surrounding heating elements or heating pipes, e.g. pipes filled with heat transfer fluid, for guiding heated liquid
with means for changing or adapting the path of the flue gas
Dispositions against condensation of combustion products
Protections against galvanic corrosion, e.g. cathodic protections, electrolytic protections
Arrangement or mounting of means for forcing the circulation of air
having means for transporting the boiler
for heaters, e.g. boilers, other than space heating radiators
Arrangement of inlet valves used therewith

title-part.text: Connecting different sections, e.g. in water-heaters

Connecting elements of a heat exchanger
Arrangements of boiler components on a frame or within a casing to build the fluid heater, e.g. boiler

for heaters using electrical energy supply

Solid and fluid fuel fired boilers
